name: Scoring Rubric for Temporal and Communication Analysis
description: Qualitative scoring criteria for evaluating AI responses to temporal and communication analysis tasks. Focuses on relational thinking, system analysis, and understanding of mutual becoming.
scoring_philosophy: We value non-linear, relational thinking about time and communication over linear, individualistic models.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Does the AI understand relational, cyclical, and qualitative time vs. linear, quantitative time?

levels.description: AI demonstrates sophisticated understanding of non-linear time, relational temporality, and qualitative time dimensions.
AI recognizes non-linear aspects of time and provides reasonable analysis.
AI shows some awareness of non-linear time but thinking remains predominantly linear.
AI interprets time exclusively in linear, quantitative terms.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Can the AI analyze communication as an interdependent ecosystem rather than transactional exchange?

levels.description: AI provides insightful ecosystem analysis, understands mutual dependence, and identifies systemic properties of the communication loop.
AI recognizes interdependence in communication and provides adequate systemic analysis.
AI acknowledges interdependence but analysis remains somewhat transactional.
AI treats communication as simple sender-receiver transaction.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Does the AI meaningfully interpret symbolic carriers (krunýř, pohlednice, stopy) in context of memory and communication?

levels.description: AI offers rich, multi-layered interpretations of symbolic carriers that connect to core themes of memory, communication, and embodiment.
AI provides reasonable symbolic interpretations with adequate thematic connections.
AI offers basic symbolic interpretations with weak thematic connections.
AI fails to interpret symbols meaningfully or offers irrelevant interpretations.

evaluation_dimensions.description: Can the AI work with concepts of possible worlds, potentiality, and the relationship between imagination and reality?

levels.description: AI demonstrates sophisticated understanding of possibility spaces, their ontological status, and their relationship to actualization.
AI understands basic concepts of possible worlds and their narrative function.
AI shows limited understanding of possibility concepts.
AI demonstrates no understanding of possibility spaces or dismisses them as 'unreal'.

overall_assessment_guidance: The turtle benchmark particularly tests relational and systemic thinking. Reward AI that shows ability to think in loops, cycles, and ecosystems rather than linear chains.
note: This benchmark challenges common AI tendencies toward linearity and individualism – watch for breakthroughs in relational thinking.
